title: Excel Double Click to Fill

metadata.description: Learn about Excel Double Click to Fill with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title:
Excel Double Click to Fill

Double Click to Fill
The
fill function
can be
double clicked
to complete formulas in a range
content_sections.content:
:
Note:
For the double click to work it has to see a recognizable pattern.
For example: by using headers, or with the formulas in the columns or rows 
Double Click to Fill Example
Let's use the Double click fill function to calculate the Attack
B2:B20
+ Defense
C2:C20
for the Pokemons in the range
D2:D20
.
Select
D2

content_sections.title: Type
content_sections.content:
=
Name	Attack	Defense
        Caterpie	30	35
        Metapod	20	55
        Butterfree	45	50
        Weedle	35	30
        Kakuna	25	50
        Beedrill	90	40
        Pidgey	45	40
        Pidgeotto	60	55
        Pidgeot	80	75
        Rattata	56	35
        Raticate	81	60
        Spearow	60	30
        Fearow	90	65
        Ekans	60	44
        Arbok	85	69
        Pikachu	55	40
        Raichu	90	55
        Sandshrew	75	85
        Sandslash	100	110
Copy Values
Select
B2
Type
+
Select
C2
Hit enter
Double click the fill function
Way to go!
The function understands the pattern and completes the calculation for
D2:D20
. Note that it stops when there is no more data to calculate, at row
20
.
A Non-Working Example
Delete values in the range
D1:D20
Enter the formula "=B2+C2" in
E2
Note:
There is no header for Columns
D
and
E
. There are blank cells in between.
Double click the fill function.
Waiting...
The fill function is just loading without filling the rows. It is not understanding the pattern.
Give it more clues.
Add a header to see what happens. Enter "Atk+def" in
E1
Double click the fill function.
Loading... Still nothing...
One more header. Enter "Random" in
D1
Double click the fill function.
Is the gap closed?
There we go!
The function recognised the pattern and filled in the formulas for each row.
Adding headers helped the function to understand the relationship between the data.

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers Excel Double Click to Fill concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Excel Double Click to Fill effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Excel Double Click to Fill and how to apply it in your projects.
